availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, merchant. Missouri native. Married to Lucy Hiatt Adams. Father of Celia Adams, Willis Adams, Jack Adams Jr., Lucy Adams, and Ida Adams. Merchant in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed William Proctor as a merchant in Rockcastle County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Rockcastle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 578-9.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 206A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, p. 35A.
"Capt. Jack Adams (1870-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #6123867, accessed September 15, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6123867.
